properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued January 13 at 4:18PM CST until January 13 at 7:15PM CST by NWS Mobile AL
properties.description:
The National Weather Service in Mobile has issued a

* Urban and Small Stream Flood Advisory for...
Northwestern Wayne County in southeastern Mississippi...

* Until 715 PM CST.

* At 416 PM CST, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to
thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding in
the advisory area. One to two inches of rain has already fallen in
northwestern portions of the advisory area. Additional heavy rain
will be moving over the area.

* Flooding will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Wayne
County.

Additional rainfall of up to two inches is expected over the area.
This additional rain will result in minor flooding.
properties.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood
deaths occur in vehicles.

Excessive runoff from heavy rainfall will cause flooding of small
creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses as
well as other drainage areas and low lying spots.

A Flood Advisory means river or stream flows are elevated, or ponding
of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent.
